block-definition.comment: Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [,,,] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].
Reports a new list containing the items of the input list, but in the opposite order.
Reports a new list whose items are the same as in the input list, except that if two or more equal items appear in the input list, only the last one is kept in the result.

Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.
Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of adding them all, so ISUM (4) (100) (8)) reports 112.
Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of multiplying them all, so (PRODUCT (4) (100) (8)) reports 3200.

Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE only if all of the inputs are TRUE, otherwise FALSE. Like AND but for multiple inputs.
Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE if at least one input is TRUE, otherwise FALSE.
Works as the map block (see map help), but it proceeds iterations concurently.
Return a sublist which contains items in the interval of 2 input numbers. Original list is not modified.
Return the index of a item in a list

block.l: You may have connection troubles. Check the host variable

inputs.input: el_registroposicion=goal_position velocidad=moving_speed torque max(%)=torque_limit activar (0 ou 1)=compliant led (color)=led

list.l: > is not in the available motors of your robot :
>no esta en la lista de motores disponibles para su robot:
> no forma parte de las primitivas disponibles para su robot:
> no es parte de los grupos de motores de tu robot :

inputs.input: registroposicion=goal_position velocidad=moving_speed torque max(%)=torque_limit activar (0 ou 1)=compliant led (color)=led

list.l: > no esta disponible en la lista de motores para su robot:

block.l: off red green yellow blue pink cyan white

list.l: off red green yellow blue pink cyan ou white

block-definition.s: $robot llevar motor(s) %'motors' a la posicion (grados) %'position' en segundos %'duration' | esperar ? %'wait'

list.l: > no esta disponible entre los motores de tu robot :

block.comment: ugly wait to stop feature. TODO : change with a looking at running primitive

list.l: > no esta disponible (mira en el bloque $robot todos los movimientos grabados )

inputs.input: offoff rojo verde amarillo azul rosado cyan blanco

block.l: off rojo verde amarillo azul rosado cyan blanco
off red green yellow blue pink cyan white

block-definition.s: $robot correr el movimiento(s) %'inputs' en forma secuencial
$robot correr el movimiento %'record_name' en inversa | a velocidad | x %'speed'

list.l: > no esta entre los movimientos grabados (mire el bloque "todos los movimientos grabados" para mirar todos los movimientos disponibles):
>no esta entre las primitivas disponibles para su robot:

block-definition.s: $robot comenzar grabación del movimiento %'record_name' con el motor(es) %'motors input'

custom-block.l: Error el nombre para el movimiento ingresado ya existe
Error de input, el motor ingresado no pertenece al robot

block.comment: Définit tous les alias ici pour des problèmes d'optimisation

list.l: > no forman parte de los motores disponibles para su robot:

block-definition.s: $robot Correr el movimiento %'record_name' en inversa | a velocidad | x %'speed'

list.l: > no esta entre los movimientos grabados (mire el bloque "todos los movimientos grabados" para mirar todos los movimientos disponibles):

custom-block.s: $robot llevar motor(s) %s a la posicion (grados) %n en segundos %n | esperar ? %boolUE
